page_content: Profile: Abhijit Sutradhar. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Abhijit Sutradhar commenced his career as a lecturer in Mathematics in the year 2010 at Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge Technologies (IIIT Nuvid), Andhra Pradesh. He has earned a bright academic career throughout first class along with more than six years of experience from Triveni Devi Bhalotia Degree College in West Bengal as an Assistant Professor, IIT Bhubaneswar as a Visiting Assistant Professor, and Siksha ‘O’ Anusandhan as an Assistant Professor. He pursued his B.Sc. in Mathematics Honours from the University of Burdwan and his M.Sc. and Ph.D. in Mathematics from IIT Kharagpur. He has been teaching different UG (B. Tech. & B.Sc.) and PG (M.Sc. & Ph.D.) courses like Engineering Mathematics-I & II, Differential Equations, Transform Calculus, Linear Algebra, Real Analysis, Numerical Analysis, Fluid Dynamics, Numerical Methods for ODE & PDE, C Programming and Data Structure, Python Programming, Data Science using Python, Graph Theory, Advanced Discrete Mathematics. His research publications reach more than 130 citations with H-index 6 in reputable journals such as Microvascular Research, Journal of Magnetism and Magnetic Materials, Journal of Fluid Engineering, Journal of Nanofluids, Transport in Porous Media, Journal of Heat Transfer, etc. Dr. Sutradhar has also organized International Conferences and a short-term training programme and has chaired sessions at international conferences. His research areas include Biofluid Dynamics, Magnetic Drug Targeting, and Nanofluidics in Porous Media. He guided eight M.Sc. students, and one research scholar has been pursuing his research works. He qualified JAM 2008, CSIR-NET (June) 2009, and GATE 2010. Among his achievements, he was awarded the First Class First in B.Sc. Mathematics Honours from the University of Burdwan in 2008. Details: Email: abhijit.sutradharfma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 55651076400. Additional Info: Awards & Honours: Received Dharani Dhar Roy Medal for becoming the First Class First from the University of Burdwan in B.Sc. Mathematics (Hons.) in the session 2005-08

Profile: Alok Kumar Panda. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Panda completed his doctorate in Biophysical Chemistry and Biochemistry from Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar. He did his postdoctoral studies in the field of lens crystallins from SUNY Albany USA. He is currently engaged both in teaching and research. The research work in his lab is mainly focused on the following aspects:
1. Exploring the role of mutations, stress and posttranslational modifications on the structure, dynamics, and function of small heat shock proteins and lens crystallins which plays a vital role in diseases such as tuberculosis and cataract. 
2. Isolation, characterization, and profiling of the bioactivities of natural products from different sources.
3. Exploring the role and interactions of ayurvedic medicines/products with biomolecules to understand and enhance the use of ayurvedic medicine as therapeutics. Details: Email: alok.pandafch@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 54581436700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=NUOQP6EAAAAJ&hl=en, Website: https:\/\/ksas.kiit.ac.in//ksas.kiit.ac.in//apandalab.com. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. Research Interests: Biophysical and Biochemistry. Projects: Title : 1.	Role of C-Terminal Domain of M. Tuberculosis Small Heat Shock Protein Hsp16.3 for Its Structure, Stability and Chaperone Function Under Thermal Stress
Funding Agency: UGC
Year: 2020
Project Status: Ongoing. Awards & Honours: 1. Postdoctoral Fellow at State University of New York, Albany, USA
2. Direct ICMR Senior Research Fellowship, Indian Council of Medical Research, India
3. JNCASR Summer Research Fellow at Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore.
4. University First Rank Holder in Chemistry Honours in Bachelor of Science (B.Sc).
5. Certificate of Merit from CBSE Board

Profile: Amalesh Kumar Manna. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Amalesh Kumar Manna has 2 years of experience in teaching undergraduate courses in Engineering Mathematics and 2 years 6 months of experience in postdoctoral research work. He got the UGC-Dr. D. S. Kothari Post-Doctoral Fellowship (DSKPDF) award in 2019. He worked as a UGC-Dr. D. S. Kothari Postdoctoral Fellow in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Burdwan, West Bengal, India. He earned his Ph.D. degree in Mathematics from Vidyasagar University, West Bengal, India. He received his M.Sc. degree in Applied Mathematics with “Operations Research” specialization from Vidyasagar University, West Bengal. He has published forty-five research papers in SCI/SCIE/ SCOPUS journals. His broad research area of interest lies in the fields of inventory control, supply chain management, computational optimization in crisp and interval environments and metaheuristic algorithms. He is currently working on inventory control and supply chain management in crisp, fuzzy, stochastic and interval environments. Details: Email: amalesh.mannafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 7005076127. Profile: Amulya Kumar Mahto. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Amulya Kumar Mahto has completed his PhD in Statistics from Indian Institute of Technology Patna, India in April, 2021. Prior to his PhD, he did his MTech (Mathematics and Computing) from Indian Institute of Technology Patna, India in 2015 and MSc (Mathematics and Computing) from Indian Institute of Technology (Indian School of Mines) Dhanbad, India in 2012. His research interests include Statistical Inferences and Data Science. He has been an excellent researcher who has published 10 journal articles of international repute. Besides his research, he has almost two years of teaching experience, which include teaching of Probability and Statistics, Statistical Inferences, R programming, Python programming, Graph Theory, Mathematics I &II etc. He has also attended and presented in many national and international workshop and conferences. Details: Email: amulya.mahtofma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57217054505, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=oI8BVh4AAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao. Profile: Anita Pati. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Anita Pati obtained her Masters Degree in Chemistry from Sambalpur University followed by M.Phil and Ph.D in Organic Synthesis from Sambalpur University under the supervision of Prof. R. K. Behera. After working as a Lecturer in Chemistry in NIST, Berhampur for some period she joined the research group of Dr. Santosh J. Gharpure and Dr. D. K. Chand, Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IITM), Chennai as a research associate to gain relevant experience in the area of application oriented organic synthesis and supramolecular chemistry. Dr. Pati also got an opportunity to work with Prof. P. S. Mukherjee, Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore with Science Academies’ summer research fellowship and added some more stars to her experience in the field of supramolecular chemistry. She joined the KIIT Family in 2013 and at present working as an Associate Professor in the Department of Chemistry, School of Applied Sciences. She has been actively engaged in teaching, research and administration at KIIT University. She is having more than 9 years of teaching experience and 16 years of research experience (including M.Phil and Ph.D). She has got the recognition from various Government Funding agencies to work on different projects and also published research papers in reputed journals. She is also a member of selected professional bodies and serves as an editorial board member for some reputed journals. Her research interest mainly focuses on Application oriented synthetic organic chemistry and supramolecular chemistry. Profile: Arijit Patra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Arijit Patra  is currently working as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar since August' 2022. Prior to joining the KIIT University, he was a Guest Faculty at Tezpur University, Tezpur, Assam. Dr. Patra completed his Ph.D. from Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology, Amethi, Uttar pradesh. He completed his M.Sc. in Mathematics from Sidho Kanho Birsha University, West Bengal and graduated from Burdwan University, West Bengal with Mathematics Honors. His research interest is in Reliability Theory, specifically in the field of Stochastic Ordering and Ageing. Apart from this he is actively involved with his research work. He has published SCI indexed research articles in various international journals of repute. Details: Email: arijit.patrafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57217514123. Profile: Arun Kumar Gupta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Arun Kumar Gupta is currently an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. A. K. Gupta completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics in the year 2017 from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha, India. He received his M. Sc. degree in Mathematics in 2011. He has more than five years of teaching experience at undergraduate and post-graduate level. He also has about Eight years of research experience in various fields of Applied Mathematics. His interest areas include numerical analysis, fractional calculus, partial differential equations, mathematical modelling, and wavelet transform methods. He authored a book entitled, “Wavelet Methods for solving Partial Differential Equations and Fractional Differential Equations” published by the CRC Press of the Taylor & Francis group. He has presented papers at various national and international conferences and has published several research articles in various international journal with high repute. He is currently supervising Ph. D. Scholars working on Partial and Fractional Differential Equations, Numerical Analysis and Wavelet transform methods. Profile: Bapuji Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Bapuji Sahoo is currently employed as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He holds a Ph.D. in Mathematics, which he obtained in the year 2022 from the Indian Institute of Technology Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Sahoo obtained his M.Sc. degree in Mathematics back in 2014 from the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, Mumbai, India. 
He taught for two years at IGIT Sarang, Odisha, and VIT-AP University, India. Furthermore, he has about six years of extensive research experience in several areas of Applied Mathematics. Dr. Sahoo's research primarily on ‘Computational Fluid Dynamics’ with a special focus on the development of higher-order compact Schemes (HOCS) and their applications in rotating fluid flow. Profile: Bidhubhusan Sahu. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Sahu earned his M.Sc. (Physics) degree from Ravenshaw University, Cuttack. Subsequently, he completed M.Phil. from Utkal University, and  obtained his Ph.D. degree in Nuclear Physics from North  Orissa University, Baripada in 2011 under the guidance of Esteemed Professor Dr. Basudeb Sahu.  Before joining KIIT in 2012, he was a post-doctoral researcher at Institute of Physics, Bhubaneswar, India from 2010 to 2012. He was awarded a DST (SERB) funded fast track project in 2014 and successfully completed in 2019. One of his student awarded Ph.D degree. Currently he is supervising two research scholars for their doctoral thesis. Dr. Sahu’s research area deals with the study of theoretical nucleus-nucleus potential, scattering and fusion phenomena in heavy ion collisions. Currently, he is working on nuclear structures and decay modes of heavy and super-heavy elements using relativistic mean-field (RMF) formalism. He has keen interest to search the possible shell/sub-shell closure in super-heavy nuclei adjacent by decay chains of alpha and other radioactive decay particles using different formulae including the Viola-Seaberg, analytical formula of Royer, universal curve formula, and universal decay law etc. Details: Email: bbsahufpy@kiit.ac.in, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=jt-0lR0AAAAJ. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. Projects: JRF, DST Project (SR/S2/HEP-18/2004), India 2006-08
SRF, DST Project (SR/S2/HEP-18/2004), India 2008-10. Administrative Responsibility: Dy Superintendent KP-VII. Memberships: OPS, ICS. Outreach Activity: Education for All

Profile: Biranchi Kumar Mahala. Role: Assistant Professor. He is currently serving in the School of Applied Sciences(Mathematics) of KIIT deemed to be University, Odisha, India. He is working on Weather Research and Forecasting especially on Tropical Cyclones, Monsoon depressions and climate simulations using Mathematical Models (WRF model and WRFDA model). Profile: Birupakhya Prasad Padhy. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Padhy has started his teaching career as a lecture in Mathematics in the year 1998. Profile: Debdulal Ghosh. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: At present, Dr. Debdulal Ghosh holds the position of Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics at KIIT Deemed to be University, located in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He is employed by the School of Applied Sciences. In 2020, Dr. Ghosh earned his Ph.D. degree in mathematics from the Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India. Profile: Dibyaranjan Rout. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dibyaranjan Rout obtained his PhD degree in Physics from IIT, Madras and subsequently joined postdoctoral position in the Department of Materials Science and Engineering, KAIST, Korea. He also served as a Research Assistant Professor in the same institute for 2 years. To his credit, he has published more than 50 papers in peer reviewed journals, handled 2 Govt. funded projects (DST, NALCO) and filed 2 patents. Under his supervision, 3 PhDs and 10 master thesis are awarded. He is having  collaboration with some premium institutes (IITs, RRCAT, IISc, IMMT, DIAT, BARC) in India.
Dr. Rout's research interest encompasses the structure-process-property relationships exhibited by functional/smart materials particularly lead-free Piezoelectric /multiferroic / high-Tc relaxor materials. He is keen to design and develop such novel and eco-friendly materials in the form of bulk ceramics, nanoparticles, nanostructures, thick films, fibers, and nanocomposites using ease and cost-effective processes (solid state, reaction, soft chemical, spray pyrolysis, electrospinning) with adequate figures of merit suitable for industrial applications (specially  actuators, MLCC, energy storage/harvesting, dye degradation). Profile: Gopal K. Pradhan. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Gopal K. Pradhan obtained his Master Degree in Physics from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar followed by his PhD in experimental condensed matter physics from the Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research (JNCASR), Bangalore. Following his PhD, he worked as a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Texas, Austin, USA and at the Pierre and Marie Curie University, Paris, France. He also worked as a visiting researcher at Lulea University of Technology, Sweden and as a research associate at the Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. Prior to joining KIIT University, he was a visiting scientist at Institute of Physics, Bhubaneswar. His broad research interest has been to understand thermal, elastic, structural and bonding properties of materials, structure-property relationship and microscopic mechanism of thermodynamically driven phase transitions using Raman and Brillouin scattering and synchrotron x-ray diffraction (XRD). Particularly, use of high pressure in condensed matter systems has been an integral part of his research activity with an active interest in the physics and chemistry of planetary interior. In particular, he is interested in understanding various condensed matter phenomena under high pressure that provides important fundamental insights on designing functional and exotic materials. He also uses his knowledge of high-pressure science in understanding the melting processes of the deep Earth, such as at the core-mantle boundary conditions. He has a sound background in high pressure methods including laser heating in ultra-high pressure conditions, Raman and Brillouin scattering, synchrotron x-ray diffraction. He has been an active user of major synchrotron based x-ray sources such as ESRF (France), ELETTRA (Italy) & APS (USA) to address some of the pressing issues in condensed matter physics and planetary interiors. Beyond his academic and research interests, Dr. Pradhan co-founded the Social Startup “Villamart” that is working to enhance and strengthen the lives of rural people particularly farmers to build strong, prosperous agricultural communities. It was adjudged as one of the top 10 social enterprises of India at the Tata Social Enterprise Challenge (TSEC 2017) conducted by IIM Calcutta. He co-founded "Bhubaneswar Area Scientific Events (BASE)", an integrated online calendar page that displays various scientific events happening in the greater Bhubaneswar area. The calendar aims to foster better academic coordination & interaction, visibility & dissemination of information to interested people. In 2007, he along with his MSc classmates co-founded "Vanivihar Physics Alumni Fund" at the Department of Physics, Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. This fund provides financial support to the poor and needy students during their financial hardship.  Besides his scientific interest, he enjoys Indian classical music, travel, cooking and Odia poetry. Profile: Jagnyaseni Tripathy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Tripathy has ~10 years of experience in teaching and Research.  Prior to joining KIIT in 2012, she had the opportunity to teach at University of Cincinnati and Michigan State University as a teaching assistant. Dr. Tripathy hails from the state of Odisha, India and has earned her PhD in Physics from Michigan State University working under the supervision of Prof. Warren F. Beck in the Dept. of Chemistry and Prof. Lisa J. Lapidus Dept. of Physics. She had then worked with Prof. Robert M. Dickson at /georgia Inst. of Technology, USA as a post-doctoral researcher, following which she joined KIIT as an assistant professor. Her broad area of interest lies in the field of biophysical research. Duly inspired by her training in multidisciplinary research involving Physics, Chemistry and Biology, she is keen on exploring the dynamics of disease related proteins using various Laser spectroscopic probes. She is currently working on developing nanoclusters  for  pathological detection and therapeutic in collaboration with Dickson research group at Georgia Tech, USA. Dr. K. Mahalik completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics in the year 2023 from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur, India. He received his M. Sc. degree in Mathematics in the year 2016 from Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India. He received his B. Sc. degree from Institute of Mathematics and Application Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He works in the field of applied functional
analysis, specifically in functional inequalities, fixed point theory, nonlinear analysis, well-posedness theory of various nonlinear inequalities, and the area closely connected to it. Profile: Krushna Gopal Mishra. Role: PROFESSOR. Bio: Krushna Gopal Mishra after the Post graduation in Chemistry in 1981, obtained his Ph. D Degree from Utkal University, Vanivihar, and Bhubaneswar. Dr. Mishra is presently serving as Professor of Chemistry in School of Applied Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. In addition to teaching & Research, Dr. Mishra has discharged various important administrative responsibilities of the University. Prof. Mishra has wide exposure in Research and Development during his tenure at RRL (presently known as IIMT-sister wing of CSIR) and at present in KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has published more than 40 publications in different national and International journals of repute and has three Patents to his credit. During his early research career he was trained in different countries namely Perth, Melbourne etc in connection with to his research work. His research interest pertains to the broad area of Electrochemistry and in specific to Corrosion, Electrodeposition, Electroless deposion, Electro leaching and electrokinetics.. Profile: Lalatendu Biswal. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr Lalatendu Biswal began his career in education as a lecturer in Physics in August 1993 in Karanjia College, Karanjia, Mayurbhanj, Odisha and has taught Physics (Hons) and Pass and in +2 classes for 15 years. Then he worked as Asst Prof in Physics in Rajdhani Engineering College, Mancheswar for two years. He joined to faculty position in Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University in July 2010, and currecting serving in position of Asst Prof -II. He holds his PhD degree from Sambalpur University. He was a senate member to North Odisha University from year 2002 to 2005. He has authored a number of published research papers and actively engaged in current research on Theoretical and Experimental Condensed Matter Physics. He is currently guiding two research Scholars. Details: Email: lbiswalfpy@kiit.ac.in. Additional Info: Research Interests: Theoretical and Experimental Condensed Matter Physics

Profile: Madhusmita Sahoo. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Madhusmita Sahoo is currently working as Associate professor (I) in the Department of Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT Deemed to be University and she joined the University in July 2010. Currently she is the Course coordinator of MATH-I (MA 1003) and an internal member of BOS. She has a research project under DAE, Govt. of India. She is a very dedicated and sincere teacher. She started her journey as a Lecturer in Mathematics in College of Engineering Bhubaneswar, Bhubaneswar in 2006. She has 16 years of Teaching Experience including 11 years of Research experience. She has a research project under NBHM, DAE, Govt. of India. She has expertise in the field of Operator Theory and Fractional Differential calculus. Dr. Sahoo completed her Ph. D. degree in the area of “Positive operators on Bergman spaces and their norm estimates” from Utkal University, M.Phil from Sambalpur University and M.Sc. from Utkal University. Prior to that she obtained her B.sc degree in Mathematics from S. V. M. College Jagatsinghpur. She has published her research wok in many national and international journal of repute. She has presented papers and participated in many International and national seminar/conferences to her credit. Dr. Sahoo is a life member of OMS. ISCA and ISTE. She was deputy superintendent of ladies hostel in the year 2012. She involves herself in various outreach programs like Art of Giving, Kanya Kiran, Plantation and Swachha Bharat Abhiyan etc. Details: Email: msahoofma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 24401901600, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=bsCkONIAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: M. Sc., M. Phil., Ph. D.. Research Interests: Functional Analysis, Complex Analysis, Algebra. Projects: Research project on “Positive Operators on Reproducing Kernel Hilbert                                                                                             Spaces and their Berazin Transform” is approved by NBHM, Govt. of India, DAE in 2016.. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator (MATH-I), Internal BOS member.. Memberships: ISCA, OMS. Outreach Activity: Kanya Kiran, Art of Giving

Profile: Mrutyunjay Das. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Mrutyunjay Das began his career as a lecturer in mathematics in the year 1999, in KIIT, Bhubaneswar. He has got a bright academic career with throughout career first class. He has got his M.Sc. and M. Phil. in Mathematics from Utkal University, Vani Vihar and Ph. D. degree from KIIT University. He has been teaching different UG(B. Tech.) and PG(MSc/M.Tech./PhD) courses like Eng. Math, Differential, Integral and Transform Calculus,  Algebra, Numerical Analysis, Probability and Statistics, Numerical Methods for ODE/PDE, Analysis of Differential Equations, Probability & Stochastic Process, Quantitative Methods, Advanced Numerical Methods and Computational Fluid Dynamics etc. He has published research articles in reputed National and International journals with high impact factors. His publications reach more than 400 citations with H-index 11. Dr. Das, has also organized International Conferences and workshops and has chaired sessions in international conferences. His research areas include theoretical/numerical investigations of the Newtonian/non-Newtonian fluid flow models. Under his guidance, one research scholar has been awarded a Ph.D. degree and another four are pursuing their research works. Dr. Das has collaborated with the professors of International and National repute for various research works. He is a reviewer of many reputed National/International journals such as Pramana, Propulsion and Power Research, Alexandria Engineering Journal, Journal of the Brazilian Society of Mechanical Sciences and Engineering, Heat Transfer-Wiley, Waves in Random and Complex Media, Fluid Mechanics and Research-Begell House etc. He has a lifetime membership at ISTE, ISTAM, Indian Science Congress and Orissa Mathematical Society. In addition to this he is an excellent mentor for guiding newly joined faculties as well as students. He has been acting as the Superintendent of Boys hostel since last 20 years. In addition to teaching and mentoring, he is managing some administrative responsibility. Presently, he is acting as the FIC of Quality Assurance Cell of the School of Applied Sciences. Profile: Nikita Mahapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. She is currently employed as Assistant Professor (I) - Biological Sciences in School of Applied Sciences, KIIT, Deemed to be University. Details: Email: nikita.mahapatrafbs@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Prasanta Kumar Das. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Prasanta Kumar Das is working as a Associate Professor of Mathematics at KIIT Deemed to be University in Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. He obtained his undergraduate degree in Mathematics (1994) from M. P, C. College (Affiliated under Utkal University, Odisha) in India. He obtained his Postgraduate degree in Mathematics (2002) from Khallikote Autonomous College (KAC) (Affiliated under Berhampur University, Odisha) in India. Dr. Das got merit certificate by getting first class first position in Mathematics at KAC.  Dr. Das received his Ph.D. in Mathematics from the Natitional Institute of Technology, Odisha (India) in 2006 under the supervision of the Professor Akrur Behera. After completion of Ph.D., he was appointed to the Department of Mathematics at Seemanta Engineering College (SEC), Jharpokharia (Odisha) in 2006 as a Lecturer and promoted to Senior Lecturer. He joined the KIIT-DU in 2011 as an Associate Professor and promoted to Associate Professor in 2018. The researh work of Dr. Das are variational inequalities, complementarity problems, fixed point theorems on set theory, differential equations, and numerical methods. Dr. Das has made over 57 publication of International repute and 06 peer reviewed papers. Dr. Das has supervised 08 Ph.D. scholars and 01 M.Sc. student.  Current research work of Dr. Das are based on following areas: 
1. Variational Inequality Problems using Fractional Calculus 
2. Variational Inequality Problems using Summability Theory
3. Numerical Approach to study Variational Inequality Problems
4. Fuzzy Variational Inequality Problems
5. Variational Inequality Problems in various spaces Details: Email: pkdasfma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 55451770500. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph. D. in Mathematics, MCA. Administrative Responsibility: Course Coordinator of Probability and Statistics (MA21001). Outreach Activity: 1. Art of Giving
2. Plantation

Profile: Priyadarshini Parida. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Priyadarshini has completed her Ph.D. from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, with the INSPIRE Fellowship Award from the Department of Science and Technology (Govt. of India). She has also done her Master in Science (Physics) from National Institute of Technology Rourkela. Following her Ph.D., she joined the Indian Institute of Technology Madras, India as an Institute Post Doctoral Fellow and worked from 2016 to 2018. Her research interest is on the Condensed Matter Theory and Computational Physics using Density Functional Theory. She is carrying out the research work on the complex oxides, transition metal-metal layers, and chalcopyrite semiconductors. She has joined the KIIT University as an Assistant Professor in the School of Applied Sciences (Physics) on January 1, 2019. Profile: Rajashree Mishra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Rajashree Mishra, currently working as Assistant Professor in Department of Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha.  Prior to that she was working as Assistant Professor in Mathematics in VITAM College of Engineering, Vishakhapatnam, Andhrapradesh. She received her Ph. D Degree from KIIT University in 2014 and completed M. Sc Degree in Mathematics in the year 1999 from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Her areas of research interest are Evolutionary Computing which specifically includes (Genetic Algorithm and Bacterial Foraging Optimization), Fuzzy probabilistic Programming and Multi-objective non linear optimization. She is having publications in reputed journals. She has presented research papers and participated in many National and International Conference of repute. Profile: Rakesh Mohan Das. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Rakesh Mohan Das joined KIIT in 2022 and is currently working as Assistant Professor (II) in the Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences. His current research interest lies in quantum optics, quantum computing and quantum information, atomic, molecular, and optical physics, and observational astronomy. He earned his five years integrated MSc. degree in Physics from IIT Kanpur, after cracking the IIT-JEE 2006. Following this, he served as an IT consultant at Polaris Software Labs, Chennai for a year. In 2012, he ventured to Japan to pursue a Ph.D. at the Institute of Advanced Energy, Kyoto University, supported by the Monbukagakusho fellowship program. During his doctoral studies, he focused on atomic, molecular, and optical physics, collaborating with J-PARC, one of the world's largest proton accelerator facilities. He was also involved with small business firms based in Osaka in app development for two years. In 2019, he completed his PhD and returned to India. He was a short-term visiting fellow at NISER, Bhubaneswar after which he joined Utkal University as a postdoctoral researcher funded by RUSA, Govt. of India. He has about five years of teaching experience and three years of corporate industrial exposure. Details: Email: rakesh.dasfpy@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56979789500, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=-hSx3_oAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D in Photon Energy Science, Institute of Advanced Energy, Kyoto University, Japan, 
Five years Integrated MSc. in Physics, Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur. Administrative Responsibility: Faculty Coordinator, Social Media Cell, School of Applied Sciences, 
Faculty Coordinator, SPIC MACAY, KIIT Student Activity Center

Profile: Rojalin Sahu. Role: Professor. Bio: Dr. Rojalin Sahu is currently working as an Professor in the department of Chemistry at KIIT deemed to be University. She has 11 years of teaching experience and 15 years of research experience. She has completed her M.Sc. and M.Phil. (Utkal University), PhD (IIT Guwahati). She is the recipient of DST young scientist travel award to present a paper at Technical University, Dresden, Germany and CONICET International Post-Doctoral fellowship. Most notably, she has been qualified Radiological Safety Officer (RSO) by BARC, Mumbai. She has been the lead Investigator of a number of externally funded projects (DST, DBT, ICMR, UGC-DAE-CSR, Ministry of Mines and BRNS). She has successfully conducted many national and international conferences as convener. She is also a NABL trained officer for Chemical Testing Laboratories. Her basic areas of research are synthesis and characterization of new Coordination Compounds and their catalytic and biomedical applications; Metal Organic Frameworks and Covalent Organic Frameworks for different application such as drug delivery, catalysis, NLO, wastewater treatment, etc. Details: Email: rsahufch@kiit.ac.in, Website: sites.google.com, Scopus Id: 57188994370, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?user=w5mu96sAAAAJ&hl=en. Profile: Sarbari Acharya. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Sarbari Acharya, has been part of the prestigious KIIT-DU since 2018. She is working as Assistant Professor in School of Applied Sciences.  She has completed her Ph.D. from Institute of Life Sciences, Bhubaneswar in 2017.  Her area of research includes nanotechnology and drug delivery for cancer therapy. Besides academics she is actively engaged in research in the filed of cancer therapy. She basically works in formulating different nanoparticles and studying their efficacy and mode of action in wide spectrum of cancer.  She has 11 peer reviewed journals and 3 book chapters to her name.Recently she is studying the effect of these formulations in targeting the tumor microenviroment and cancer stem cells which are some of the major reasons for cancer aggressiveness and relapse.She has recently received a project grant from UGC-FRPS for a project entitled “Comparative therapeutic efficacy of different phyto-nanotherapeutics in overcoming drug resistance in breast cancer cells Details: Email: sarbari.acharyafbs@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 36190380700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=hZ1uR6UAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D Life Science. Research Interests: Nanotechnology and drug delivery. Projects: Comparative therapeutic efficacy of different phyto-nanotherapeutics in overcoming drug resistance in breast cancer cells (UGC). Profile: Saumya Ranjan Jena. Role: Associate Professor(II). Profile: Soumen Dhara. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Soumen Dhara received his Ph. D in Physics in 2012 from Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati, India. Following his Ph. D, he moved to Japan with prestigious 'JSPS postdoctoral fellowship' from the Govt. of Japan and worked as a postdoctoral researcher at Kobe University, Osaka. After this tenure, Dr. Dhara continued his research as a senior Postdoctoral fellow at different renowned universities, S. N. Bose National Centre for Basic Sciences, India; Cambridge University; Cardiff University, United Kingdom; and Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore. He has more than 15 years of teaching and research experience, and published more than 38 research articles including 1 review article in high-profile international journals (SCOPUS and SCI indexed) and 4 book chapters to his credit. He also served as an Editor in 2 peer-reviewed book projects (international). His research trust areas of interest are semiconductor nanostructures (nanowires, thinfilms, heterostructures), optoelectronics, solid state lighting and light sensors, spectroscopy of nanomaterials including ultrafast laser spectroscopy, thin-film transistors (TFTs) etc. He has been awarded two major research projects one from JSPS, Govt. of Japan and another one from SERB, Govt. of India. Details: Email: soumen.dharafph@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57201620718, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=t7IHkmsAAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info:

Profile: Soumen Giri. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Soumen Giri is an Assistant Professor (Grade II) at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He obtained his Ph.D. from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Kharagpur in 2014. Following his doctoral studies, Dr. Giri conducted postdoctoral research at the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology, Japan, from 2015 to 2017. Dr. Giri has a strong publication record, with over 32 peer-reviewed journal articles and a book chapter to his credit. He has published several high impact factor journals such as Advanced Functional Materials (IF:19.2), Journal of Materials Chemistry A (10.7), ACS Sustainable Chemistry and Engineering (IF: 7.1), Nanoscale (IF: 5.8) etc. He also secured starting research grant (SRG) of 29.3 Lakhs from SERB, Govt. of India.  His research spans several cutting-edge areas in energy storage and synthesis technologies, including: Micro-Batteries: Development of micro-batteries for portable electronic applications.
Supercapacitors: Fabrication of supercapacitors and their applications in high-altitude regions.
Electrode Materials: Discovery of novel electrode materials for advanced energy storage technologies.
Electro-Organic Synthesis: Innovations in electro-organic synthesis for applications in pharmaceuticals and energy storage.
Dr. Giri's contributions to science and technology have been recognized internationally, with his recent selection as a Brain-Pool Fellow by the Government of Korea for 2024, an honor that underscores his impact in the field of advanced materials and energy technologies. Details: Email: soumen.girifch@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 0000-0002-1405-1496, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&tzom=-330&user=xMXDH2gAAAAJ. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D from IIT Kharagpur, Postdoctoral Fellow: OIST Japan. Projects: Next generation high energy dense, durable dual-ion micro-supercapattery…..”, sponsored by SERB-SRG (Govt. of India), amounting to 29.3 lakhs, 2023. Administrative Responsibility: Interdisciplinary Taskforce on EV Tech. Awards & Honours: Brain-Pool Fellow, offered by South Korean Government. Memberships: Americal Chemical Society (ACS)

Profile: Soumyaranjan Mohapatra. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Soumyaranjan Mohapatra is currently working as an Assistant Professor-II in the Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar, India. He has more than five years of teaching and ten years of research experience. Dr. Mohapatra completed his B.Sc. (Hons.) in 2010 from Ravenshaw University, Cuttack and M.Sc. (Physics) in 2012 from Berhampur University, Odisha. He has completed his Ph.D. (in Experimental Condensed Matter Physics) in 2018 from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha. Following his Ph.D. he joined as a postdoctoral fellow at National Institute of Science Education and Research (NISER), Bhubaneswar, Odisha. Till date, he has published more than 40 research articles in peer reviewed journals of international repute. His researchvinterest includes experimental low temperature condensed matter physics, multiferroics and magnetoelectric coupling." Profile: Srikanta Behera. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Srikanta Behera is currently working as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. S. Behera completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics in the year 2022 from National Institute of Technology Rourkela, Odisha, India. He received his M. Sc. degree in Mathematics in 2015. He has two years of teaching experience at undergraduate level. He also has about six years of research experience in various fields of Applied Mathematics. His interest areas include numerical analysis, differential equations (ODEs and PDEs), integral and integro-differential equations, wavelet transforms. His broad area of research is wavelets based numerical techniques for solving integral and integro-differential equations. Details: Email: srikanta.beherafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57052365900. Additional Info: Awards & Honours: “Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research (INSPIRE)" fellowship vide Grant No.

Profile: Srikumar Acharya. Role: Associate  Professor. Bio: Dr. Srikumar Acharya is currently working as an Associate Professor-I in the department of Mathematics  at KIIT deemed to be University. He  has 11 years of teaching experience and 15  years of research experience. He received his PhD degree in Operations Research from Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur India. His PhD thesis was on ‘Multi-choice programming problems and its applications’. Before joining as a JRF in IIT Kharagpur for PhD programme, he received his M.Phil. and M.Sc. degrees in Mathematics from Berhampur University and Ravenshaw (Autonomous) College (Utkal University), respectively. So far, he has published a good number of research papers in various international journals and conferences. He has successfully conducted some national and international conferences.  He has been serving as a reviewer for many international journals such as: IJSS, IJOCTA, IJMOR, EJOR etc. His areas of research are fuzzy programming, linear programming, mixed integer programming, multi-choice programming,  nonlinear programming, stochastic programming and transportation problem. Details: Email: sacharyafma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 25959871200, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=NaLnks8AAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao. Additional Info:

Profile: Subhadarshan Sahoo. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Subhadarshan Sahoo is currently an assistant professor in the Department of Mathematics, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT), Bhubaneswar, India. He has more than seven years experience in research and teaching. Dr. Sahoo completed his Ph.D. in 2018 from National Institute of Technology, Rourkela, India. He has published many peer reviewed research papers in numerous fields and various international SCI journals of repute, like Applied Mathematics and Computation, Communication in Nonlinear Science and Numerical Simulation, Nonlinear Dynamics, Transaction ASME Journal of Applied Mechanics, Journal of Computational and Nonlinear Dynamics, Computers and Mathematics with Applications, Journal of Computational and Applied Mathematics, Mathematical Methods in the Applied Sciences, Computers & Fluids, and Communications in Theoretical Physics, etc. For a detailed citation overview, the reader may be referred to Scopus. To date, he has more than 39 research papers published in journals of international repute, including more than 37 SCI journal papers. His current research interest includes the analytical methods, Numerical methods, Lie symmetry analysis for the solution of partial and fractional differential equations. Details: Email: subhadarshan.sahoofma@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 56472352700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?view_op=search_authors&mauthors=SUBHADARSHAN+SAHOO&hl=en&oi=ao, Website: https:\/\/ksas.kiit.ac.in//ksas.kiit.ac.in//emathexpert.com/. Profile: Supriya Roy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Supriya Roy recieved his doctorate in Physics in 2014 from Department of Physics, IIT Guwahati.Then, he joined as an Assistant Professor in Department of Physics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT, Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. Here, he teaches Engineering Physics to B. Tech. students as well as M. Sc. course. He got Post Doctoral experience in the Institute of Physics, Academia Sinica, Taipei, Taiwan during 2016-2020. Presently he joins back to KIIT and continuing his service. His field of research covers a vast area such as biophysics, soft matter and ionic diffusion in solid state electrolyte materials. He uses computational simulation techniques, such as molecular dynamics, monte carlo etc. to pursue his research. Profile: Sutanu Mangal. Role: Assistant Registrar & Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Sutanu Mangal completed his Ph.D. from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur in 2011. During his doctoral studies, he was awarded a European Union Fellowship by the Ministry of University, Government of Italy, to support his research on semiconductor device fabrication for photovoltaic applications. His Ph.D. work involved the successful deposition of III-V semiconductor layers such as InGaP, GaAs, and InP using Metal-Organic Chemical Vapor Deposition (MOCVD). After completing his Ph.D., Dr. Mangal joined KIIT University in 2011 as a faculty member in the School of Applied Sciences. He later pursued postdoctoral research at Academia Sinica in Taipei, Taiwan, where he specialized in low-energy single- electron microscopy for imaging 2D materials. At KIIT, Dr. Mangal’s primary research focuses on semiconductor thin film deposition and device fabrication, with applications in photovoltaics and sensors. His research group is currently making significant strides in perovskite solar cell technology, achieving remarkable scientific advancements in the field. In addition to his academic and research pursuits, Dr. Mangal plays an active role in academic administration. He currently serves as Assistant Registrar of KIIT University and is a member of both the Academic Council and the Executive Council. Details: Email: sutanufpy@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 57196977238. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: M.Sc., Ph.D. Research Interests: Semiconductor Science and Technology, Semiconductor based device fabrication,
Thin films deposition, Semiconductor based photovoltaics and sensors. Profile: Swetapadma Praharaj. Role: Assistant professor. Bio: Swetapadma Praharaj obtained her M.Tech degree in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering from NIT, Roukela and was awarded with Institute silver medal for her performance. Thereafter, she completed her PhD in Physics, KIIT-DU, during which she developed her expertise on the development of lead free piezoceramics and improvement of their figures of merit. She has keen interest to develop high strain and temperature stable high Tc ceramics (applicable in actuators, sensors and capacitors) by compositional engineering. She is proficient in evaluating the performance based figures of merit of materials in terms of S-E, P-E, Dielectric and impedance spectroscopy. To her credit, she has published her work in many peer reviewed journals. Profile: Tapas Ranjan Sahoo. Role: Associate Professor. Bio: Dr. Tapas Ranjan Sahoo, is doctorate in Chemical Sciences by I.I.T. Kanpur, India and postdoctoral fellow at University of Amsterdam, Netherlands and Politecnico di Torino, Italy. He has obtained his M.Sc. degree from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Currently, working as an Associate Professor (II) in Department of Chemistry, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. He has over 11 years of experience in teaching and administration at KIIT University. During this period, he has guided 4 PhD students and 6 MSc projects. Qualified GATE in Chemistry (2004) with 98.55 Percentile and All India Rank: 48, Dr. Sahoo has also been selected for Professor Dayanidhi Patnaik memorial award for best research paper (2017), by OCS and as Visiting Professor to IIM Indore. Dr. Sahoo's research group mainly focuses on synthesis of Metal Oxide, Mixed Oxide and Rare Earth Metal Oxide nanoparticles and its adsorption and photo catalytic activities for waste water treatment as well as dielectric, magnetic and biological applications. Profile: Utkal Keshari Dutta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Utkal Keshari Dutta is currently working as Assistant Professor at the Department of  Mathematics, School of Applied Sciences, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He has completed his M.Sc in Mathematics from Pondicherry University, Puducherry, India in 2015, and M.Phil in Mathematics from VSSUT, Burla, India in 2016. He received his Ph.D from Sambalpur University, Sambalpur, India in 2021. His research interest is in Number Theory, specifically in the field of Analytic Number Theory, Recurrence Sequences, Diophantine Equations, Multiple Zeta Functions, Arithmetic Functions etc. He has published 14 SCI/SCOPUS indexed research papers in various mainstream journals. Profile: Venkateswara Rao. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. V. Rao Mundlapati is a Senior Assistant Professor in the Department of Chemistry at KIIT Deemed to be University. He obtained his PhD from the National Institute of Science Education and Research (NISER), Bhubaneswar, in 2018. With a diverse research background, Dr. Mundlapati has expertise in several areas including Density Functional Theory (DFT) calculations, conformational studies of peptide foldamers, non-covalent interactions, laser spectroscopy, astrochemistry, and environmental chemistry. 
Dr. Mundlapati brings over six years of postdoctoral experience, having worked in prestigious research institutions across Europe. At CEA, CNRS, and the University of Paris-Saclay, France, he conducted laser spectroscopic studies of sulfur-containing peptides. He further contributed to the field of astrochemistry by studying the spectroscopic properties of Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbon (PAH) cations and their derivatives under astrophysical conditions at the Institut de Recherche en Astrophysique et Planétologie (IRAP), CNRS, and CNES in Toulouse, France. Additionally, he has collaborated on environmental chemistry research at Université de Lille, CNRS, PhLAM - Laboratoire de Physique des Lasers, Atomes et Molécules, Lille, France. 
At present, Dr. Mundlapati is actively involved in both teaching and research. His current research focuses on the role of non-covalent interactions in stabilizing biomolecules and materials, computational studies using DFT, and spectroscopic investigations of astrochemical environments. He is also dedicated to advancing knowledge in environmental chemistry, with an emphasis on understanding molecular interactions and their implications in both natural and synthetic systems. Profile: Vijil Kumar. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. Vijil Kumar is currently working as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Mathematics, in the School of Applied Sciences at KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India. Dr. Vijil Kumar has completed his Ph. D. in Mathematics and Computing in the year 2022 from Indian Institute of Technology (ISM) Dhanbad, Jharkhand, India. He received his Master’s degree in Mathematics from Gurukula Kangri Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar, in 2015. He has 1 year of teaching experience at U.G. and P.G. level. He also has about six years of research experience in various fields of Applied Mathematics. His research interest areas include Numerical Analysis, Differential Equations (ODEs), Astrodynamics, Orbital Dynamics, Space Trajectory Optimization and Machine Learning. His broad area of research is space trajectory optimization based numerical and optimization techniques for solving ordinary differential equations. Profile: Dr Mrs Chandana Mohanty. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Dr. (Mrs.) Chandana Mohanty has 5 years of post graduate teaching experience in Biotechnology and Life Science and more than 8 years of post-Ph.D. extensive research experience. Her areas of research interests are Nano medicinal approach for cancer therapy and Tissue engineering. Dr. Mohanty completed her Ph.D. in Zoology from Berhampur University, Odisha and for her outstanding academic performance in MSc degree in Zoology, She got Dr.P.k. Baliarsingh best Student Award. She got Best teacher award in fish biotechnology vicinity at Fishery science department Utkal University for contribution as a teacher and student project activities accelerator. She has availed post doctoral research fellowship from DST, consequently awarded Fast Track Young Scientist Award (Early Career Research Award) by Science & Engineering Research Board (SERB)-DST, New Delhi and Women’s Scientist Research Grant by DST-Government of India in the field of Life Sciences. She has been successfully completed two research projects as principal investigator, funded by DST, SERB and one sanctioned from UGC (FRPS). She received two international travel grant to present her research work at Magaliesburg, South Africa and Qubec city Canada. She is also a member of selected professional bodies and serves as editorial board member and reviewer for reputed journals. She has published 22 research papers in journals of international repute with couple of patents to her credit (one technology transfer for commercialization) Details: Email: chandana.mohantyfbs@kiit.ac.in, Scopus Id: 26635637700, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=SE_vcC0AAAAJ&hl=en. Additional Info: Educational Qualification: Ph.D. Research Interests: Cell biology, Genetics and Nanotechnology. Projects: "1. Project title: Polymeric curcumin sponge: anapproach of curcumin delivery for streptozetocine induced diabetic rat for dermal wound healing, DST SERB (completed).

2. Project title: Nanomedicinal triple therapy with gemcitabine, hedgehog inhibitor and immune- stimulant: A therapeutic boon for pancreatic cancer, DST WOSA (completed).

3. Project title: A comparative study of various topical formulations of curcumin
towards diabetic wound healing in a rat model UGC(FRPS) (Approved in year 2019).". Administrative Responsibility: Course coordinator (Biology). Awards & Honours: 1. DST SERB Fast track scientist ( 2012).
2. DST WOS A (2015).
3. UGC (FRPS) (2019).
3. Technology transfer and commercialisation of patent US 9271934 B2.
4. International travel grant from CSIR South Africa (2011.)
5. International travel grant from DST India (2012).. Memberships: Controlled Release Society (CRS), Microbiology society  India. Outreach Activity: Controlled Release Society (CRS), Microbiology society  India, Biological science
